basics.name: Prachi Goyal
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: A Software Engineer with a specialization in API development, deep learning, and systems optimization. Proven experience in building large-scale systems and research in federated learning.

publications.title: Importance Sampling Based Federated Unsupervised Representation Learning

work experience.name: Microsoft
work experience.summary: Building impactful APIs for Microsoft Graph Teams, specializing in meetings, teams, and channels. Developed a CI/CD pipeline for a Business Intelligence data pipeline.
highlights: Specialization in API development and DevOps
Built APIs for Microsoft Graph Teams
Developed a CI/CD pipeline for Business Intelligence
On-call for large-scale systems, reliability, and optimization

work experience.name: Microsoft
work experience.summary: Worked on ECS flighting system for Audio, Signal and MediaTA under OneDrive SharePoint.
highlights: Implemented ECS flighting system for Signals
Developed private preview tasks for specific tenants

work experience.name: Atletik Games
work experience.summary: Developed Android games based on deep learning for Physical Education during Covid-19 lockdown.
highlights: Integrated state-of-the-art pose and object detection models
Deployed games to 3 schools with 500+ students

research_experience.title: Federated Learning with unannotated data
highlights: Developed a novel FL algorithm for unsupervised and personalized representation learning, later published in ICASSP 2024.
Used Variational AutoEncoders to formulate clients' unlabelled and non-IID data to gaussian distributions.
Aggregated distributions using mean-field formulation. Used importance sampling based weights for calculating reconstruction loss.
Is-FedVAE outperformed SoTA FL baselines and demonstrated faster convergence and higher accuracy.

research_experience.title: Vehicular Planning using Deep Reinforcement Learning
highlights: Worked on optimizing Autonomous Agent Vehicle communication for local and extended view under bandwidth constraints using Deep Reinforcement Learning methods.
Surveyed literature and designed an architecture for multi-modal learning giving multiple outputs. Curated a reward system for efficient learning.

research_experience.title: Plug-and-Play Platform for COVID-19 Resource Allocation
highlights: Developed a reinforcement learning (RL) based platform for efficient resource allocation during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Designed a generalized platform that could optimize the allocation of any resource by taking input datasets and considering relevant columns.
Applied actor-critic methods to optimize allocation, ensuring a scalable, plug-and-play system for varied use cases.

research_experience.title: SeekSuspect
highlights: SeekSuspect is an interactive facial image retrieval model that uses visual memory as input to retrieve faces from a large-scale database.
Fine-tuned pre-trained ResNet and VGG-16 models, improving accuracy from 82% to 86% by enhancing efficiency and embedding extraction.
Evaluated and compared various clustering algorithms for embedding extraction, improving model performance and retrieval accuracy.

education.institution: Indraprastha Institute of Information and Technology Delhi (IIITD)

achievements and responsible positions.title: Women Techmakers Engineering Fellow Scholarship
highlights: Selected among 120 scholars from over 15,000 applicants across India to receive a USD 2,400 scholarship.
Participated in coding bootcamps focusing on coding practices, design thinking, and hands-on projects as a freshman.

achievements and responsible positions.title: AI/ML Head
achievements and responsible positions.organization: Google Developer Student Circle, IIIT Delhi
highlights: Organized workshops on machine learning for peers in IIIT Delhi.
Created and actively engaged in a telegram forum to foster learning and discussion in machine learning.

achievements and responsible positions.title: Contributor at Leadership Connection Pillar
highlights: Responsible for conducting and hosting AMAs with senior leaders at Microsoft for the TWaM community.

publications.name: Importance Sampling Based Federated Unsupervised Representation Learning
publications.summary: Published work on a novel FL algorithm for unsupervised and personalized representation learning.

projects.title: Intersection Problem in Highway-Env (Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning)
highlights: Designed and implemented multi-agent deep reinforcement learning models for safe intersection handling in complex highway environments.
Trained multiple agents using Double Q Network architectures with hard-parameter sharing to enable cooperative decision-making.
Enhanced performance metrics through custom reward tuning and model optimizations.
Tools: Python, Gym, Stable Baselines, Keras.

projects.title: Image-to-Image Translation (Deep Learning)
highlights: Implemented and evaluated models for Reverse Semantic Segmentation and Super Resolution tasks using state-of-the-art architectures.
Applied and tuned Pix2Pix, pSp encoder, and SRGAN models to achieve high-quality outputs with fast convergence on Cityscapes and CelebA-HQ datasets.
Tools: C#, .NET, SQL, XML.

projects.title: Color Switch Game (JavaFX Game Development)
highlights: Developed an interactive color-switching game as a first full-scale project in JavaFX, implementing UI diagrams and detailed class structures.
Applied Object-Oriented Programming principles including inheritance and abstraction to design efficient gameplay mechanics.
Tools: Java, JavaFX library.

projects.title: Linux Shell (Systems Programming in C)
highlights: Designed a custom shell to execute internal and external Linux commands, leveraging system calls and standard C libraries.
Implemented a robust command parsing mechanism to handle multiple commands and arguments efficiently.
Tools: C programming, Linux System Calls.

projects.title: Handwriting Recognition (Deep Learning)
highlights: Built a handwriting recognition model achieving 85% accuracy, applying concepts learned from Andrew Ng's Deep Learning Specialization.
Implemented a CNN-BLSTM architecture and evaluated using CTC (Connectionist Temporal Classification) for sequential data recognition.
Tools: Python, Keras.

projects.title: Trsna - Smart Water Tap Extension (Arduino-based Prototype)
highlights: Developed a smart water tap extension system using Arduino and sensors to optimize water usage based on an account-based control system.
Collaborated in a team project, overcoming challenges in hardware integration and sensor calibration to ensure functional water flow control.
Tools: Arduino, Sensors, C programming.
